content.webTitle: Record £175,000 fine imposed on radio station

fields.headline: Record £175,000 fine imposed on radio station
fields.bodyText: Kiss FM has been fined £175,000 - the largest financial penalty imposed on a commercial radio station by the media watchdog Ofcom - following 10 complaints in seven months about its breakfast show. The fine includes £75,000 for a prank call and £100,000 for sexual content and offensive language broadcast when children were listening. Kiss is the first station to be fined over a fairness and privacy complaint after its Streetboy show called a man who had been made redundant and humiliated him. Emap, which owns Kiss FM, acknowledged the broadcast was a "horrible intrusion".
